alert.note: Alert for San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; Southwest Mountains; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 4:18PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN CATRON COUNTY THROUGH 445 PM MDT... At 417 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pietown, or 19 miles northwest of Datil, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Omega and Pietown. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 42 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.

area.areaDesc: San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; Southwest Mountains; West Central Mountains
